sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Evaluate (A Δ B) ∩ B and (B Δ A) ∩ A. Show that the result are not equal, thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
